rename.from: [ASK] How to set sqlite database backend mlflow in computing cluster?
rename.to: [BUG] How to set sqlite database backend mlflow in computing cluster?

body: Could you try starting the tracking server's host as, instead of (default) `--host localhost --port 5000` instead set it to `--host 0.0.0.0 --port 5000` so that multiple machines can interface with the server on that port?

@BenWilson2 It does not work.

If I set `mlflow server --backend-store-uri=sqlite:///mlrunsdb15.db --default-artifact-root=file:mlruns --host 0.0.0.0 --port 5000` on the linux terminal, I have two choices in python script:
1. `mlflow.set_tracking_uri('http://localhost:5000')`, then error was 
```Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/urllib3/connection.py", line 174, in _new_conn
    conn = connection.create_connection(
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/urllib3/util/connection.py", line 95, in create_connection
    raise err
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/urllib3/util/connection.py", line 85, in create_connection
    sock.connect(sa)
ConnectionRefusedError: [Errno 111] Connection refused
...........
.........
........
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "run.py", line 165, in <module>
    mlflow.set_experiment("lung_fun_db15")
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/fluent.py", line 110, in set_experiment
    experiment = client.get_experiment_by_name(experiment_name)
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/client.py", line 462, in get_experiment_by_name
    return self._tracking_client.get_experiment_by_name(name)
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/client.py", line 162, in get_experiment_by_name
    return self.store.get_experiment_by_name(name)
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/store/tracking/rest_store.py", line 297, in get_experiment_by_name
    for experiment in self.list_experiments(ViewType.ALL):
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/store/tracking/rest_store.py", line 77, in list_experiments
    response_proto = self._call_endpoint(ListExperiments, req_body)
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/store/tracking/rest_store.py", line 56, in _call_endpoint
    return call_endpoint(self.get_host_creds(), endpoint, method, json_body, response_proto)
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/utils/rest_utils.py", line 249, in call_endpoint
    response = http_request(
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/utils/rest_utils.py", line 163, in http_request
    raise MlflowException("API request to %s failed with exception %s" % (url, e))
mlflow.exceptions.MlflowException: API request to http://localhost:5000/api/2.0/mlflow/experiments/list failed with exception HTTPConnectionPool(host='localhost', port=5000): Max retries exceeded with url: /api/2.0/mlflow/experiments/list?view_type=ALL (Caused by NewConnectionError('<urllib3.connection.HTTPConnection object at 0x2aabd74d7400>: Failed to establish a new connection: [Errno 111] Connection refused'))
```

2. `mlflow.set_tracking_uri('sqlite:///mlrunsdb15.db')`, then the code can run for several minutes but at some time the error occured: 
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1015, in _commit_impl
    self.engine.dialect.do_commit(self.connection)
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/default.py", line 685, in do_commit
    dbapi_connection.commit()
sqlite3.OperationalError: disk I/O error

The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/store/db/utils.py", line 79, in make_managed_session
    yield session
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/store/tracking/sqlalchemy_store.py", line 633, in _log_metrics
    _insert_metrics(metric_instances)
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/store/tracking/sqlalchemy_store.py", line 630, in _insert_metrics
    session.commit()
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/sqlalchemy/orm/session.py", line 1431, in commit
    self._transaction.commit(_to_root=self.future)
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/sqlalchemy/orm/session.py", line 836, in commit
    trans.commit()
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 2378, in commit

  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 2568, in _do_commit
    self._connection_commit_impl()
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 2539, in _connection_commit_impl
    self.connection._commit_impl()
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1017, in _commit_impl
    self._handle_dbapi_exception(e, None, None, None, None)
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 2043, in _handle_dbapi_exception
    util.raise_(
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/sqlalchemy/util/compat.py", line 207, in raise_
    raise exception
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1015, in _commit_impl
    self.engine.dialect.do_commit(self.connection)
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/default.py", line 685, in do_commit
    dbapi_connection.commit()
sqlalchemy.exc.OperationalError: (sqlite3.OperationalError) disk I/O error
(Background on this error at: https://sqlalche.me/e/14/e3q8)

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "run.py", line 174, in <module>
    run(args)
  File "run.py", line 144, in run
    best_valid_loss = step('valid', net, data_dt['valid'], loss_fun, opt, i, target, mypath, False, best_valid_loss)
  File "run.py", line 84, in step
    log_metric(mode+'MAEBatch_All', mae_all, data_idx+epoch_idx*len(dataloader))
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/fluent.py", line 583, in log_metric
    MlflowClient().log_metric(run_id, key, value, int(time.time() * 1000), step or 0)
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/client.py", line 690, in log_metric
    self._tracking_client.log_metric(run_id, key, value, timestamp, step)
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/client.py", line 226, in log_metric
    self.store.log_metric(run_id, metric)
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/store/tracking/sqlalchemy_store.py", line 598, in log_metric

  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/store/tracking/sqlalchemy_store.py", line 667, in _log_metrics
    _insert_metrics(non_existing_metrics)
  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/contextlib.py", line 131, in __exit__

  File "/home/jjia/.conda/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/store/db/utils.py", line 86, in make_managed_session
    raise MlflowException(message=e, error_code=BAD_REQUEST)
mlflow.exceptions.MlflowException: (sqlite3.OperationalError) disk I/O error
(Background on this error at: https://sqlalche.me/e/14/e3q8)

```
@BenWilson2 Thanks ! It started to work when I set `mlflow.set_tracking_uri('http://login-ip-address:5000')`
Awesome! Glad that you're up and running! :)
